docs.snippet: JIMMY STEWART, It's a name that makes conservatives salute the flag and liberals cringe and movie buffs feel a little warm inside. Jimmy  Stewart, super-patriot. SUPER-SUPERSTAR. And how many older actors can you really say that about any more? Wa...
docs.lead_paragraph: JIMMY STEWART, It's a name that makes conservatives salute the flag and liberals cringe and movie buffs feel a little warm inside. Jimmy Stewart, super-patriot. SUPER-SUPERSTAR. And how many older actors can you really say that about any more? Wayne ... Lancaster ... Grant ... Peck. Fonda, maybe.

docs.snippet: ONE of the hottest issues embroiling the nation's capital and newsrooms everywhere is Attorney General John N. Mitchell's move to subpoena unused parts of inter  views with controversial political figures. While executives of the broadcast and pri...
docs.lead_paragraph: ONE of the hottest issues embroiling the nation's capital and newsrooms everywhere is Attorney General John N. Mitchell's move to subpoena unused parts of inter views with controversial political figures. While executives of the broadcast and print media have been rallying together to fight Government intrusion into their reporters' operations, this column has managed--at great expense and even greater danger--to procure copies of several television films and videotapes on the Justice Department's "Most Wanted" list.
docs.abstract: D Carlinsky and E Goodgold, noting Atty Gen Mitchell's attempts to subpoena unused TV films and tapes, parody 'controversial' TV ints

docs.snippet: The hazards of fortune on Broadway are such that within four days an unheralded and unsung play opens and proves to be a winner, while a musical in preparation for several years ends its run after four "public" performannces and 28 previews with a...
docs.lead_paragraph: The hazards of fortune on Broadway are such that within four days an unheralded and unsung play opens and proves to be a winner, while a musical in preparation for several years ends its run after four "public" performannces and 28 previews with a loss of $400,000.

headline.main: Unheralded Play a Hit, While 'Gantry' Departs

docs.snippet: A group of school officials and parents from West Harlem and Upper Manhattan, incensed over a drug case at Junior High School 52 on Monday in which a 14-year-old boy died and three others were hospitalized, stormed down to City Hall yesterday to d...
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of school officials and parents from West Harlem and Upper Manhattan, incensed over a drug case at Junior High School 52 on Monday in which a 14-year-old boy died and three others were hospitalized, stormed down to City Hall yesterday to demand a meeting with Mayor Lindsay.
docs.abstract: group of school officials and parents from W Harlem and Upper Manhattan go to City Hall to demand meeting with Lindsay; meet with Deputy Mayor Aurelio after hr of shouting protests; he pledges to ask police to speed up enforcement of narcotics regulations in dist and to press for other remedial measures; Lindsay, at earlier news conf, discusses drug abuse problem among teen-agers; NYC Med Examiner says White's death resulted from deliberate overdose of barbiturates; boy's former teacher discusses drug problem at school; Alston comments

headline.main: Parents Storm City Hall Over Boy's Pill Death; Parents and School Aides Storm City Hal1 Over Boy's Death
